column5: message
Update go.mod

stack: add support for Go 1.13beta1

It now prints 'pc' in addition to 'fp' and 'sp'.

Include unit test.

stack: add race detection code but keep it disabled

This is because Context cannot yet return the data properly.

Improves #27

stack: improve indented parsing

It was not handling empty lines properly.

panic: increase unit test coverage a tiny bit

Disable output unless go test -v is used.

panic: add unit test

Covers at 97%. Refactor code to reduce the amount of code conditionally
compiled.

Reduce caching, which seems to cause very weird travis errors. In
particular, make sure github.com/maruel is not cached.

stack: tolerate indented stack traces

This happens with goconvey. This changes the semantics significantly but
it should do a good job making it work better for users.

panic: add stack_cut_off_named

It calls 2000 named functions deep, enabling what looks like inlining.

panic: make it work on go1.7.6

Replace sort.Slice() with strings.FieldsFunc().

sort.Slice() was introduced in go1.8.

I need panic to work on go1.7 to diagnose an issue with
'additional frames elided' not being printed anymore.

panic: update asleep reference about hanging with -race

Tested on go1.12.5.

This is a known issue. https://github.com/golang/go/issues/20588

panic: add asleep

When locking a mutex recursively, it panics with
    fatal error: all goroutines are asleep - deadlock!

stack: improve parsing by trimming CRLF explicitly

Does the LF/CRLF trimming upfront instead of having each regexp do it.
This will scale better as more regexp will be written to handle the race
detector output.
README.md: Add Authors section

stack: add unit test that confirms that race conditions are not parsed yet

Now that the state machine is created, we could reuse similar logic for
the race condition trace. I think it can be done without a breaking
change, by adding new members to Context.

Improves #27

stack: convert to a brand new explicit state machine

This makes the parser much more reliable. That should have been done
from the start. Oh well.

Improve unit testing and cover the whole state machine.

This will unblock #27 as this can be added as a set of new states.

Fixes #2

travis: rewrite the travis configuration; update README.md badges

- Stop using pcg. While it has been useful, most of its features are now
  upstream. go test now caches binaries, now runs in parallel, merging
  coverage isn't that hard and we can call gofmt, go vet and golint
  directly.
- Enable GO111MODULE=on now that pcg is not used anymore.
- Bump from trusty to xenial.
- Run ineffassign, shadow.
- Switch from goveralls to codecov.io, I prefer its web UI.
- Update badges in README.md.

panic: add reference to _TracebackMaxFrames

This name of the variable may change in the future in runtime but it
still gives an idea where to search for.
README.md: add hint about inlining

Switch to go.mod

Keeps the vendored files, but that the occasion to update them.

Did approximatively:

- git rm -rf vendor Gopkg.*
- git commit -a -m .
- Move the directory out of GOPATH
- export GO111MODULE=on
- go mod init
- go test ./...
- go vendor
- Edited go.mod to specify "go 1.11" instead of "go 1.12".
- git add .
- git commit -a --amend <this content>

Then I add to add GO111MODULE=off before calling pcg in .travis.yml
because it confuses it. I will have to fix pcg or stop using it eventually.

stack: move parsing constants

There was in stack.go, but used in context.go, so move them there.

No functional change.

stack: Fix unit test TestAugment on go1.11 and later

Zap out arguments expectation on go1.11 and later

Where arguments used to be listed explicitly, they are now listed as
"(...)". This broke the unit tests.

For example with "panic slice_str", go1.10.8 prints:
  GOTRACEBACK=all
  panic: ([]string) (0x499cc0,0xc42000a0e0)

  goroutine 1 [running]:
  main.panicslicestr(0xc42000a0c0, 0x1, 0x2)
  (...)

whereas on go1.11beta1 the last line is:
  main.panicslicestr(...)

So I bisected Go. In this example, Go is checked out as ~/src/golang,
~/src/golang/bin is in PATH and there's a Go installation at ~/go1.4 for
bootstrapping.

  # Testing script:
  $ cat > ~/test_golang.sh <<EOF
  #!/bin/bash
  set -eu
  cd ~/src/golang/src
  ./make.bash
  go install github.com/maruel/panicparse/cmd/panic
  panic slice_str |& egrep 'main.panicslicestr\(0x'
  EOF
  $ chmod +x ~/test_golang.sh

  # Bad commit
  $ cd ~/src/golang
  $ git merge-base go1.11beta1 origin/master
  a12c1f26e4cc602dae62ec065a237172a5b8f926
  $ git checkout a12c1f26e4cc602dae62ec065a237172a5b8f926
  # Confirm this exit 1
  $ ~/test_golang.sh

  # Good commit
  $ git merge-base go1.10 origin/master
  4c4ce3dc79fcf535045e69068b15142d8b7259cd
  $ git checkout 4c4ce3dc79fcf535045e69068b15142d8b7259cd
  # Confirm this exit 1
  $ ~/test_golang.sh

  # Bisection
  $ git bisect start a12c1f26e4cc602dae62ec065a237172a5b8f926 $ 4c4ce3dc79fcf535045e69068b15142d8b7259cd
  $ git bisect run ~/test_golang.sh
  $ git bisect reset

Also fix travis on go1.8.x, lock it to go1.8.7. This is because pcg
tries to install goimports, which cannot be built on go1.8.7 anymore.

Fixes #42

Remove github.com/maruel/ut from Gopkg.toml

Prune tests, non go files, unused packages.

Ran dep ensure -update

stack: move Example to separate test package

This makes the code copy-pastable, which is much more useful for users.

stack: change []Goroutine to []*Goroutine

Using a slice of objects was an error in hindsight. This is much more
efficient when constructing the slice, as each Goroutine instance is
fairly large.

Fix html regression in 8fe0a69c9dd8b4

Add simple unit test to stop regressing.

stack: Rename Bucketize to Aggregate, simplify Bucket

Change the returned slice to be a slice of pointers, which makes sorting
more efficient.

Simplify tests in bucket_test.go to be more focused.

stack: Move Bucketize tests into bucket_test.go

No functional change.

stack: unexport Less

This further reduce the API surface, making it more user friendly.

Eventually Signature.Less() will be user-provided in Bucketize() so
users can decide what ordering they want. See issue #23.

stack: unexport SortBuckets and Buckets

This significantly reduce the API surface. The only drawback is that it
is now not possible to not get the unsorted buckets, but I don't see a
use case for this.

stack: unexport Equal, Similar and Merge

This greatly simplify the API surface and users can reimplement these if
they want their own bucketing algorithm.

May reexport if there is a good use case.

Switch code to use keyed member in initialization

May make future refactoring simpler.

No functional change.

stack: shorten names

In Go, characters are costly (tm) so rename Function to Func and Source to Src.

Change methods on Func, Arg and Args be all using pointer instead of struct
copying, which is inefficient. Update call sites.

This is another breaking change.

internal: fix unit test regression

Also remove logs in tests for packages stack and internal, unless the flag -v is provided.

Move Palette from stack to internal

It's getting in the way for HTML generation, and it doesn't make sense
to live in the stack parsing package.

This is yet another breaking change.

Fix regression in last commit

pp would crash if there was no stack trace found. Oops.

stack: Create Context and make guessing local source location optional

ParseDump now returns a *Context instance, which optionally contains the deduced
GOROOT and GOPATH.

This removes the global variables goroot and gopaths, which removes the
need for stack.NoRebase(). This was the last global context in this
package.

stack: remove goroot/gopaths references in parsed items (Call)

This is a breaking change.

- Rename LocalSourcePath as LocalSrcPath.
- LocalSrcPath and IsStdlib are now member instead of methods.

stack: move context parsing into context.go

stack.go was fairly large. Splitting makes it more manageable. This will
help fixing the unit tests later.

stack: small error tweak to ParseDump

Trim the line whitespace and use %q, which results in nicer quoting.

stack: migrate line parsing code into a function

This makes the line parsing a bit easier to read. Still work to do.

No functional change.

Addresses issue #2

stack: move local variables into a struct

Create a struct to hold parsing states. It's very far from a state machine but
that's a step in the right direction.

Addresses issue #2

stack: move scanLines lower

No functional change; reduces the delta in a follow up change.
stack: extract string creation from Palette into Signature

Fix PR to work and minor stylistic fixes

This still needs work:
- filtering is only when used at the console, not with HTML output.
- I'm unsure if filter should be on the header or on the whole stack.

allow matching and filtering traces

Fix #31

Update vendors

Now that ut dependency is removed, this removes a few additional dependencies.

Remove all dependencies on github.com/maruel/ut

Makes tests slightly longer but one less dependency
Fix "Current not implemented on freebsd/amd64" error (#39)

Enable guessing GOROOT and GOPATH

Add -rebase=false as an option to disable this functionality.

Fixes #35.
Add go report card tag, it's cute
Fix more typo and remove unreachable code
Fix copy pasted typo
stack: minor micro optimization

stack: move bucketizing code into bucket.go

This is to shorten stack.go, as some refactoring is planned.
README.md: clarify vendoring and API breakage vs major version

pp: add -html

-html permits generating a web page as a self-contained file instead of output
at console.

For now it just recreates a similar output to what is printed in the console.
The end goal is to be able to present way more information, like inline source
code.

Fixes #36
panic: add args_elided and stack_cut_off
panic: remove a testing left over from ae340c405388339c

pp: only silence SIGQUIT when input stream is piped in

When a file path is provided as an argument, do not silence SIGQUIT.

cmd/panic: promote as tool from internal/crash

Will be useful for smoke testing.

Add 'panic race'.

Will be used to help implement the race detector parsing, see #27.

internal/panic: add tool to generate panics

The source code is designed to scale to a large number of panic styles.
Eventually testing should be transformed to smoke tests that run this tool, this
way this will test the whole toolchain behavior.

stack: don't try to read past the end of a file.

If the sources on disk do not match the sources used to build a binary, a line
number in the call stack may not exist anymore, as the source file may have been
shortened.

This should really need a unit test. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Fix #38

Add map and channel type (#34)

* Add map and channel type

* Add tests for map/channel type

Closes #30

* Better handle complex types

* Update name to use switch statement

* Skip processing of last Stack.Calls element instead of first

The leaf function wasn't being processed before, so the following snippet:

  package main

  func g([]string) {
    panic("g")
  }

  func f(map[int]int) {
    g(make([]string, 5))
    panic("f")
  }

  func main() {
    f(map[int]int{})
  }

resulted in:

  panic: g

  exit status 2

  To see all goroutines, visit https://github.com/maruel/panicparse#GOTRACEBACK

  18:25:04.051198 load(/path/to/main.go)
  1: running
      main main.go:4  g(0xc420045ee8, 0x5, 0x5)
      main main.go:8  f(map[int]int(0xc420078000))
      main main.go:13 main()

and now results in:

  panic: g

  exit status 2

  To see all goroutines, visit https://github.com/maruel/panicparse#GOTRACEBACK

  18:25:42.981470 load(/path/to/main.go)
  1: running
      main main.go:4  g([]string(0xc420045ee8 len=5 cap=5))
      main main.go:8  f(map[int]int(0xc420066000))
      main main.go:13 main()

fix parsing in presence of carriage return (#33)

When parsing output of debug/pprof/goroutine?debug=2 the lines
have CRLF terminator.
Fix >50% in README.md

Switch vendoring to github.com/golang/dep

Update vendor/ at the same time.

DROP TESTING ON 1.5. Not worth the trouble. Seriously, update now.

Update .travis.yml and improve test output; drop 1.4, 1.6, 1.7

- drop Go 1.4, 1.6, 1.7; the stack trace cannot be parse correctly w.r.t
  the unit test. 1.6 and 1.7 should probably fixed but 1.4 is kinda old.
- add 1.8; it passes just fine
- use latest of each Go version
- include test name in failure

Update .travis.yml to explicitly test multiple Go versions

Include 1.4, 1.5, 1.6 and latest 1.x

source: fix brittle unit test

- Rewrite source_test.go to be more maintainable
- Fix brittle test case that was breaking on recent Go version
- Fix bug in environment variable override

Improve README.md comment about /usr/bin/pp on OSX

Fixes #28

Update vendor/

Keep golang.org/x/sys stripped out because it is large.

Update stack/source_test.go expectation with new float encoding on go 1.8

The floating point value encoding is non-deterministic in Go and the value on
the stack varies across versions. Add a new encoding.

Change the floating point value in expectation.

2.0 can be expressed as 0x40000000 or 0xc440000000.

Give up on older Go version on travis.

goveralls require recent Go version.

Migrate vendoring from Godeps to govend; using native go1.6 vendoring.

Ran:
  govend -v -t -u -l --prune
  rm -rf vendor/golang.org

Removed golang.org/... since it's pretty large.

Get rid of gitter link and older screencasts.

I updated the first screencast for b04458315c7b1b022b47fa5366788b8d0b7d0cc3
which changed -parse to be the default but haven't updated the other ones.
Remove them from here for now until I take the time to update them; it would be
useful to update the goroutine categorization one since it's a nice non-obvious
feature. These screencasts also make the README very busy so it's not bad to
clean up the README a bit.

I never used the gitter chat room.

Make -parse to be the default. No crash has been reported for a while.

Use `pp -parse=false` to disable source parsing in case a problem is faced.

Handle the case where the source file is "??".

Add more comments about how the parsing is done, since the regexp by itself is
obscure.

Add regression test case.

Fix #21.

Implement sources reading!

This gives panicparse superpowers. It is able to deduce the types and be much
smarter in the way it present the information.

The code is still brittle and expected to fail in exotic cases. Please report
failures upstream. This is why it is not enabled by default, one has to use the
-parse flag to use this functionality. Eventually the flag will be enabled by
default and a -no-parse may(?) be added.
Add an example how to use the library.

Externalize stack.Palette to present Buckets.

This effectively export the code to pretty print analyzed stack traces. By
default an empty Palette{} will not add colors. It's up to the user to either
copy-paste internal.defaultPalette or create one.

ui.go has 100% test coverage.

Fixes #8.

Fix build on go <=1.5. (bis)

Totally shamecube worth.
Fix build on go <=1.5.

Add a banner on Go 1.6 when GOTRACEBACK is not set.

Change the README.md header so it can be referenced by the code. The is shown
when Go 1.6+ is used, GOTRACEBACK is not set or set to single and there's only
one trace shown.
Add note about using GOTRACEBACK=all in 1.6.

Add experimental chat.

I'll see how it goes.

Abstract the Palette into its own struct.

The goal is to eventually export internal.Process() as part of issue #8.

This removes the need for NewANSIStripper().
Reduce the number of exported symbols.

Refactor Signature, split in Stack. Add sleep range in bucket.

Split Signature in two, Signature and Stack. This makes the separation more
logical. Add SleepMin and SleepMax, so that a range of sleep can be properly
presented to the user. Update main to present this range.

This is a big refactor so there's a risk I messed up. Please contact me if you
see anything suspicious.

Fixes #9

Implement -aggressive.

Warning: THIS IS A BREAKING CHANGE. You need to update calls to Similar() and
Bucketize() to use stack.AnyPointer.

It's for issue #9
More test coverage, fix one crash.

Convert high intensity (90) to bold (1).

Remove the use of white and black in most cases. This is to ease users
using a terminal with a white background, which is the default on OSX.

Fix #11

Remove accidental tabs.

No code change.

Handle when stdout has lines longer than 64kb.

bufio.ScanLines() would fail by default in that case, returning
bufio.ErrTooLong. Instead of increasing the buffer without bound, change the
scanning function to return these partial lines and change the stdout handling
loop to properly process these incomplete lines.

Be more stringent about trailing LF on the last line.

Includes regression test.

Fixes #17
Add warning about future breaking changes.

Refactor in preparation for issue #8.

Split the serialization into independent functions and make them return a
string.

Add TODOs about future breaking changes. Will likely do around the same time
issue #9 is implemented since it is also a breaking change.

Fix lint regressions.

- Remove stale comment about go-colorable. It was confirmed to work.
- Reorder arguments so -full-path is up front.
- Fix an error in Signature.Equal() that didn't compare Locked state. This was
  incorrect.

Add -full-path option.

This is expected to make the path clickable in some IDE.

Add more known GOROOTs: c:/go, /usr/lib/go and /usr/local/go.
Add TODO to guess GOROOT instead, e.g. assume runtime.GOROOT() but switch
dynamically based on what is given.

Fix #12

Merge pull request #13 from mattn/isatty

Use go-colorable on Windows to bring back coloring.

Switch internal IsTerminal implementation to the one provided by go-isatty.

Fix #4
colorable on windows

Improve README.md section.

Add notes in README.md about PowerShell, fish shell and zsh.

Move installing bash v4 on OSX and /usr/bin/pp in a "Tips" section at the
bottom.

Fix #15.

Use mattn/go-isatty instead of ssh/terminal

ssh/terminal is too bigger to do it.
Update README to clarify bash v3 vs v4

Add 'thread locked' parsing.

This state also needs to be parsed manually, handle it in a similar way to
Sleep.

Fix bucketing on goroutine hung for several minutes.

In this case, the runtime appends '[NN minutes]' which breaks bucketing, as each
goroutine will have slept for a different amount of time.

Partially fix #9.
Add deadlock screencast.
Replace screenshot with screencast

Add -v, add stack.Args.Processed.

stack.Args.Processed will eventually be filed with data from the source files.

Refactor logic to nameArguments() to increase readability.
Add note about conflict with /usr/bin/pp
Remove coveralls badge, it's broken.
Update pre-commit-go to pcg.

Add c:/go/src as a predefined GOROOT.

This is a sane assumption and it helps when pasting in a trace that occured on
Windows.
Fix import path to use the internal one.

Improve color management.

- Disable colors when no terminal is found.
- Disable coloring on Windows for now until a working solution is found.
- Use godep save -r plus trim unnecessary files to make the project self
  contained.
Create cmd/pp because 10 chars is too much.

Fix a test regression where it was hardcoded to my workstation.

Reduce the number of references to maruel's github account.
Surface Signature.StackElided to UI

Fix two parsing bugs.

- Add support for elided stack when the stack is >100 depth long
- Add support for package-less function, would previously crash
Fix parsing when there's no offset but a fp & sp dump.

Fix a crash, improve ordering, improve parsing.

- Improve ordering to be more consistent; the more private functions in stack,
  the higher they are in the output. Inversely, the more stdlib functions in
  stack, the lower they are in the output.
- Parse call stack entries with fp=0x123 sp=0x123
- Parse call stack entries with
  "goroutine running on other thread; stack unavailable"

Add aggressive goroutine stack grouping based on ptr difference in arguments.

This changes the API a bit so this is a breaking change for package stack.

This should help on servers when there's a lot of goroutines but each processing
a different object.

Merge pull request #6 from xyproto/documentation

Fixed the headlines
Fixed the headlines
Oops, output isn't deterministic, will fix later
Replace arguments 0x0 with 0, much more readable
Improve README.md, adding Features section.
Make the output deterministic. Improve test.

Fix regression in output; only symbolize pointers in primary goroutine

- Args.String() must not be with pointer receiver otherwise it's not used by
  fmt.Printf().
- Add a test to catch this regression by testing main.go directly.
- Prioritize pointer IDs to the primary goroutine.
Fix Windows, second try.
Add .travis.yml, fix tests on Windows.

Remove the need to download github.com/shiena/ansicolor on non-Windows.

Update README.md to include build status and code coverage.

Add back support for elided arguments list.

Fix regression in main.go's source code formatting, oops.

Use named pointers for pointer recurring multiple times in the trace.

This permits easier eye scanning by replacing long pointers with short IDs.

Add preliminary support for Windows.

For odd reasons only the rest gets colored, will look into it later.
At least output is readable.

Improve parsing and grouping.

- Now properly parses stacks with .c and .s sources
- Correctly print function without a package, e.g. findrunnable() and schedule()
  in proc.c.
- Group stdlib-only stacks at the bottom; it makes the dump much easier to scan
  for user code.
- Consider _test/_testmain.go as stdlib, since it is generated by "go test".
  This simplifies looking at go test stack dump.

Added tests.
Add note about deadlock and Ctrl-\ on POSIX

Silence SIGQUIT in addition to SIGINT.

This permits using Ctrl-\ with albeit slightly more noise in the output.

SIGQUIT doesn't exist on Windows but a dummy value is defined, so conditional
compilation is not required.

Streams stdin to stdout on the fly.

This removes the need for -all and makes the tool usable in long lived processes.
Use new screenshot3.png in README.md

Improve parsing to parse createdby source.

Improve output readability.
Improve test readability.
Fix parsing of 'created by', add test case, add comments
Add titles to screenshots
Add second screenshot to README.md
Add reference to screenshot

Split parsing code into package 'stack' and add unit test.

The package 'stack' is reusable.

Improve parsing, alignment and coloring. Use different color for package name
and for the function.

Update README.md as the example is not good anymore.

Add args, parse quoting.

Fixes #1

Multiple improvements.

- Fix parsing of stack traces when it contains "<autogenerated>".
- Add color; green for stdlib, red for other code.
- Add more comments.

Make panicparse ignore Ctrl-C.

This makes possible to pipe a process that is Ctrl-C'ed out into panicparse,
while panicparse ignores the signal and outputs the result.
Made sorting more deterministic
Initial commit of panicparse.
